Comments_List: I learned a ton of grammatical skills, plenty of pronunciation, and a load of Kanji from this class.
A grasp of higher-level grammar points such as comparisons, and thinking conditionally.

The strengths of this class involve the engagement between student and material during class time. I do believe the workload is a bit much, but I also think it is necessary for learning such a complex language.

Strengths: Great course for beginning to intermediate Japanese students with food pace and rewarding homework.

Weakness: Attendance and participation not strictly enforced; many students show up late or dont prepare for class. They suffer no repercussions, and detract from learning in group conversations.
If someone is actually serious about learning Japanese, this class is ESSENTIAL. Otherwise, it does pose a ton of work.
Yes. I really feel like Ive gotten quite close to an intuitive grasp of the grammar itself, rather than memorizing phrases or vocab as Ive done in other language courses.
